channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8962] Clean up code and remove regular log splitting
item.description: Distributed log splitting has been out there for a while and it is kind of stable. It's about time to get rid of the regular log splitting and clean up the code a little bit.
item.summary: Clean up code and remove regular log splitting

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: What branches are you targeting?
0.98 and 0.95.2. Is it too soon for 0.95?
Thanks.
This patch removed the non-distributed log splitting as distributed log splitting is stabilized.
lgtm. Should there be more code removed that what is in the patch?
Not much removed it turns out. There are some code in HlogSplitter which can be removed. But they are used in unit tests and some other tools, which needs some refactory. Should we do it now?

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12592650/trunk-8962.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 12 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.TestAccessController

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6362//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6362//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-prefix-tree.html

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6362//console

This message is automatically generated.

Remove it now? Good removing tests too.....

I took a look at test failure. It is a complaint that a table exists even though this is our first attempt at create. Will look at it more in a mo.

Hmm... it just failed over on apache too. https://builds.apache.org/job/hbase-0.95-on-hadoop2/181/testReport/org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access/TestAccessController/testGlobalAuthorizationForNewRegisteredRS/

Looks like my 'fix' here in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HBASE-8964 broke this. Will fix later this evening.

Attached v2. It cleaned up HLogSplitter, changed unit tests like TestHLogSplit to use the same method used by distributed log splitting. Couple unit tests were removed since not fit with distributed log splitting.

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12593019/trunk-8962_v2.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 24 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6402//testReport/

This message is automatically generated.
+1 Skimmed. Lots more code being removed. Will rely on fact that tests passed. Good on you Jimmy.
Should a note be added to refguide that hbase.master.distributed.log.splitting is not used any more ?
Ted Yu No. That is what release notes are for (Jimmy, make a fat one when you commit)
If it is mentioned in the refguide, refguide should be amended. Can be done in different patch
Thanks for the review. This configuration is not mentioned in the code base (including refguide) any more.
+1 on removing. Did not review the code though.
Integrated into trunk and 0.95.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: As distributed log splitting is getting more and more stable, non-distributed log splitting is removed and not supported any more. The configuration hbase.master.distributed.log.splitting is also removed, which used to the configuration to turn distributed log splitting on (true) and off (false).
